thread.title: For Faster Checkout and Storage At Home, Group Related Groceries Together
thread.title_full: For Faster Checkout and Storage At Home, Group Related Groceries Together

author: Stephanie Lee
title: For Faster Checkout and Storage At Home, Group Related Groceries Together
text:
Image by eddie.welker. This tip goes out to anyone who likes to stay as organized as possible, even when it comes to grocery shopping . You can make the process so much smoother at checkout and when you put away your groceries at home by grouping similar items in your cart. Here’s how it works.
Top 10 Mistakes We Make When Grocery Shopping (And How to Fix Them) Top 10 Mistakes We Make When Grocery Shopping (And How to Fix Them) Top 10 Mistakes We Make When Grocery Shopping… Buying groceries is one of those universal chores most of us could probably do better at, whether… Read more Read more
Normally, when most of us go grocery shopping , we toss things into our cart like we’re on the set of a game show. Food52 suggests that you don’t think of your shopping cart as a dump truck. Rather, think of compartmentalizing your foods to help your future cashier or bagger help you .
Advertisement
Advertisement
Keep the refrigerated with the refrigerated; the dry goods with the dry goods; the potatoes, onions, and other counter-top dwellers together; the fragile vegetables in another section of your cart (preferably that protected upper level); and so on and so forth. Then, unpack your cart with these groups in mind, too , so that the friendly cashier can place them in bags in an organized fashion that’ll ultimately make it faster for you when you’re unpacking at home.
Nice and simple.
A Quick Tip for Streamlining Your Grocery Shopping | Food52
Stephanie Lee stephanie.lee@lifehacker.com @superlee7 Contributing writer at Lifehacker.com
